mixed-citation.article-title: One new genus and nineteen new species of ground spiders (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from Iran, with other taxonomic considerations

tp:treatment-sec.p:
While comparing our specimens to the species reported from Europe, we realized that
Berinda idae Lissner, 2016
(described from Greece and later reported from Cyprus ) is undoubtedly a junior synonym of
Heser infumatus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872)
(from Greece , Tanzania , Egypt and Israel ; introduced to Japan ). The copulatory organs are identical (cf. Lissner & Chatzaki 2016 : figs 2–3 and Levy 1998 : figs 112–115) and both have been recorded from Greek islands. The long filiform embolus, robust conductor and distinctive tibial apophysis conform to
Berinda
rather than
Heser Tuneva, 2004
(see
Panayiotou et al. 2010
). Thus, a generic transfer is proposed, resulting in the new combination
Berinda infumatus
comb. nov. (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872).
